intro: Sloanea arfakensis, commonly known as the Arfak mountain sloanea, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Indonesia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Sloanea arfakensis is typically found in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the nutrient-poor soils of its habitat. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem.
